Typealiases.html#/s:15FunctionalSwift6Re.name: Result
Typealiases.html#/s:15FunctionalSwift6Re.abstract: Result representation of Ether type where left value is Error and right value is success.

Protocols/Monoid.html.name: Monoid
Protocols/Monoid.html.abstract: The protocol of monoids (types with an associative binary operation that has an identity).

Classes/MVar.html#/s:15FunctionalSwift4M.name: init(value:)
Classes/MVar.html#/s:15FunctionalSwift4M.abstract: Create an MVar which contains the supplied value.

Classes/MVar.html#/s:15FunctionalSwift4M.name: take()
Classes/MVar.html#/s:15FunctionalSwift4M.abstract: Return the contents of the MVar. If the MVar is currently empty, take() will wait until it is full. After

Classes/MVar.html#/s:15FunctionalSwift4M.name: put(_:)
Classes/MVar.html#/s:15FunctionalSwift4M.abstract: Put a value into an MVar. If the MVar is currently full, put(_:) will wait until it becomes empty.

Classes/MVar.html#/s:15FunctionalSwift4M.name: tryPut(_:)
Classes/MVar.html#/s:15FunctionalSwift4M.abstract: A non-blocking version of put(_:). The tryPut(_:) function attempts to put the value a into the MVar.

Classes/MVar.html#/s:15FunctionalSwift4M.name: tryRead()

Classes/MVar.html.name: MVar
Classes/MVar.html.abstract: An MVar (pronounced “em-var”) is a synchronising variable, used for communication between concurrent threads.
